page.title: 05Haltwhistle Railway Station.
page.content: Haltwhistle is on the Newcastle Carlisle railway line. It is a very long station, the two platforms are 387 metres long. The buildings are painted blue and white. There were wild flowers growing in the old sidings and on the wall. There is a man working in the signal box and sometimes the men who mend the railway line stop at the station. Twenty seven trains a day stop at the station but as it is an unstaffed halt you have to buy your ticket on the train. It costs{Â£2.40}to go to Newcastle and{Â£1.60}to go to Carlisle on the diesel trains. People going to work use the early trains and people going shopping. All the children going to the High School at Haydon Bridge from Haltwhistle travel by train.
